lines.text: Hey, Butch. Ya got a cigarette?

[hands him a pack]
Sure. Help yourself.

[examines the pack]
Jap cigarettes!
Yeah. They're half tobacco, half stinkweed.
Oh, well now I'll enjoy them more than ever. I thought they were *all* stinkweed.
As soon as our planes get here they'll be sorry. They won't look so pretty!
Yeah, but where *are* our planes?
Maybe if we keep digging we'll come up someplace around Ebbets Field.
Yeah, I'm practically standing on second base right now.
Hey, Tex.
Yeah?
Hot, ain't it?
Yeah. Hotter'n a Texas cattle call in August.
So you think it's hot, do ya?
Yeah.
How'd you like a nice tall glass of ice cold beer?

Beer! Strictly a middle class beverage. The last time I was back in Brooklyn, there was just such a night as this. We was havin' cocktails. My old lady brought 'em in, I took one taste, and boy what a kick. You know what she did?
What?
She took 'em out and put in another slug of gin.
[smiles]
What a sweet old lady.

[In dugout waiting out a heavy artillery barrage]
I don't mind the one with my name on it. It's the one that says, 'To whom it may concern' that I don't like.
[after the barrage increases]
They're throwing everything at us but the kitchen stove.

[after an even louder explosion]
That's the stove now!
Hey Hook?
Yeah.
How do you feel about killing... people?
Well, it's kill or be killed, ain't it? Besides, those ain't people.
Yeah, I know, but the first time you got one of 'em.
Well, it was kinda rugged I guess, then it's just a matter of repetition. Quit thinking about it. You'll go crazy.
[repeated line]
Where's me helmet? Where's me helmet?
